[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "If then differentiation be...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from explaining Spencer’s essay to citing expert opinions (Darwin, James).
[STRUCTURE]: Slightly disjointed critique of Spencer’s narrow focus without clear lead-in.

[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary and complex sentence structures may impede readability.
[SYNTAX]: Overly long, nested sentences with multiple clauses.

[STRUCTURE]: Assumes extensive background knowledge of Spencer’s works.
[CLARITY]: Abrupt transitions between defending Spencer’s scope and quoting philosophical concepts.
